definition: to make an appointment/to invite/approximately/pact/treaty/to economize/to restrict/to reduce (a fraction)/concise
to weigh in a balance or on a scale

sentences.english: If they feel good, they will book you.
sentences.chinese: 如果他們覺得好，他們就會預約你。

sentences.english: The receptionist schedules all the doctor's appointments twenty minutes apart.
sentences.chinese: 接線員將醫生所有的預約排程爲間隔二十分鐘。

sentences.english: The second part is to analyze the legal effect of the precontract.
sentences.chinese: 第二部分是對預約法律效力的分析。

sentences.english: On that Friday I had an eye doctor appointment.
sentences.chinese: 那個週五我和眼科醫生有預約。

sentences.english: The more slap-up the restaurant is, the more necessary to preengage.
sentences.chinese: 越高檔的飯店越需要事先預約。

sentences.english: Guests can also free use the brandnew hot spring baths with a appointment.
sentences.chinese: 住宿貴賓可不限次數預約無償使用全新私人風呂湯屋。

sentences.english: Booking are needed to be made at least 3days in advance.
sentences.chinese: 租埸需於最少三個工作天前預約。

sentences.english: Tods booking service was great as spoke good English and understood what we wanted.
sentences.chinese: 一口流利的英語和理解讓我們感覺預約服務很棒。

sentences.english: Call in advance and ask for special guest relations.
sentences.chinese: 提前向特別客戶關係部預約。

sentences.english: Our shop accepts advance telephone orders for special Spring Festival goods.
sentences.chinese: 本店承接電話預約辦年貨業務。

sentences.english: I'd like to book a hair-dressing appointment this afternoon, please.
sentences.chinese: 我想預約今天下午去美髮廳做頭髮。

sentences.english: I made an appointment for a perm.
Kathy and Susan are about to book a lane in their local bowling alley.
sentences.chinese: 凱西和蘇珊正在當地的一家保齡球館準備預約球道。

sentences.english: The property is available for preview daily from 1 to 4 pm and by appointment.
sentences.chinese: 每日下午1點到4點可入宅預覽，請提前預約。

sentences.english: The average time between appointments is six to eight weeks. I have hundreds of clients.
sentences.chinese: 平均兩次預約做頭髮之間會有六到八週的時間。

sentences.english: I aborted the idea to retreat and booked the retest for him.
sentences.chinese: 我打消了放棄的念頭併爲他預約了重考。

definition: to place an order/to book ahead
to sign up/to enter one's name/to apply/to register/to enroll/to enlist
to reserve a seat/to book a table/reservation
to agree/to conclude/to draw up/to subscribe to (a newspaper etc)/to order
plan/project/program/to plan/to map out/CL:個|个[ge4],項|项[xiang4]
to place an order/to order/an order (of goods)
to bloom/to open/to be open (to the public)/to open up (to the outside)/to be open-minded/unrestrained by convention/unconstrained in one's sexuality
